front.title: SCL: A SIP Processing Configuration Language

abstract.t: SIP, a widely accepted Internet standard protocol for VoIP, is flexible enough to allow different extensions. The SIP-ALG (SIP Application Layer Gateway) in NAT/Firewall or, more broadly, the SBC (Session Border Controller) needs to be configured to handle properly SIP messages with extensions. We propose an XML-based SIP Processing Configuration Language, by which one can define the legitimate SIP message components and the way for the SBC to handle SIP messages, legitimate or not.
